metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7656 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
jquery prior to 1.9.0 allows Cross-site Scripting attacks via the load method. The load method fails to recognize and remove "<script>" HTML tags that contain a whitespace character, i.e: "</script >", which results in the enclosed script logic to be executed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-jquery - 3.2.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is likely an intrusive, backwards-incompatible change that may break existing software. We will not be fixing this issue in stable Ubuntu releases.

criterions.comment: jquery package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.1-1').
